owl:Ontology.dc:creator: Eeva Järvenpää
owl:Ontology.dc:description: ProductModel ontology is defining product requirements. It defines the structure of product; its associations and liaisons; process requirements in terms of capabilities, and their parameters.
owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: Product Model ontology
owl:Ontology.dc:rights: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License (CC BY-SA 4.0). To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Product Model ontology
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment:
The ontology has been defined at Tampere University of Technology, Finland, by Eeva Järvenpää, Niko Siltala and Otto Hylli. The research has received funding from the European Union Horizon 2020 Programm under grant agreement nbr 680759 (Project ReCaM - Rapid Reconfiguration of Flexible Production Systems through Capability-based Adaptation, Auto-configuration and Integrated tools for Production Planning)
Licencing: Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License (CC BY-SA 4.0) To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/
Product Model (PM) ontology used for representing the product's parts, structure and processing requirements.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This class is used to store processes which are not directly bringing value to the product, but which are needed for the process.
NonGeometricFeature class includes features that are not geometric. These can be for example parameters or other metadata.
Process is a subclass of Activity. Process can have multiple sub-processes, where the order of processes is defined by dependencies (process 1 has to be completed before process 2).
Part is a single entity in the product. One part can also be a product.
This class contains information about protrusion in an object
Coordinate class represents the position coordinates of a entity. Coordinate can be world coordinate, tool point coordinate or frame position coordinate depending on the feature itself.

Setup class is reserved for activities relating to setting up machines. These are activities which can not be regarded as processes from the product point of view, but which need to be done in order to the process to take place.

owl:Class.owl:versionInfo: TODO: This class is currently under construction.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Geometric features relating to the product. This class is intended to store information on such geometric features, which affect to the required capabilities.
This class contains details about fixation, which is done by using certain kind of fixing elements. This is used to indicate how many similar fixing elements (e.g. screws) belong to certain assembly.
This class is used to save information of screws (or bolts) in the product
SurfaceTreatment class represents the surface treatment of a product. It can be for example plastic coating, filming of the plastic...
Activity class is for storing the processes and their occurances.
Product is any manufactured, handled or processed part or combination of physical parts. It is the final product from the modeller's perspective. It may be a single assembly or part.
Assembly class is for any manufactured, handled or processed combination of physical parts. Assembly must include at least two parts or other assemblies.
This class is used to save information about rivets used in the product
This class is used to save information about the nails in the product .
Orientation class is for presenting the orientation of a feature. It is presented in quaternion.
ProductElement class is the super class for products, assemblies and parts.
This class is used to model the shallow cylinder shapes.
Shape and size of an object .

owl:Class.owl:versionInfo: TODO: How to eliminate the need to model each similar fixing part as a separate instance? Or should they be modelled separately? Each needs to be assembled anyway, so they affect to the process.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This class contains different fixing parts that are part of the product.
Tolerance class includes the tolerance values a face can posses. This class is under construction.
This class contains information about the hole in an object.
Material class is used to store specific material instances.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A process may need some setup activities, before it can take place.
Activity requires one or many process capabilities. This property is used to make the reference to the correct level on the process taxonomy, where the required parameters are also defined.
This property defines the raw material of the given part.
This property is used to relate a geometric feature to certain object.
Activities performed on a product element. Product element may be part, assembly or complete product.
This property is used to model the shape and size of an object.
Defines the occurance order of the activities. An activity can have multiple dependencies, e.g. activities 1, 2, 3 and 4 must be completed before the activity 5 can occur.
This property specifies the features that the entity has. Feature may have multiple sub-features.
Can include one or many instances from the class Part or Assembly.
This property indicates the features or products where the non-geometric features are referring.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Depth of the hole to be drilled.
Length of the rivet mandrel (the rivet rod which is done inside the riveting gun and from which the rivets are "cut" during the riveting process).
Dimension of an entity in x-direction
Dimension of an entity in z-direction
This property defines what is measured.
Diameter of the hole to be drilled .
Number of occurences of the same activity
Maximum force that can be applied
This is a parent property for all the process (capability) related parameters related to product's processing.
Required number of rotations that must be taken.
Type of the rivet that should be rivetted.
Width of the object that interfaces with the tightening tool.
Type of the o-ring mounting. May be either "internal" or "external"
Dimension of an entity in y-direction
Required shape of the rivet head after the riveting process.
This property is used to indicate if automatic matchmaking is required for the process step or not. Gets boolean value.
Size of the nut to be attached.

owl:TransitiveProperty.rdfs:comment: A process can have multiple sub-processes, which are defined through this property.

owl:FunctionalProperty.rdfs:comment: Unit: Seconds (s)
Duration of the activity in seconds.
posX tells the value of X coordinate.
entityID is a unique identifier of a given entity.
This property defines the Z vector component of the orientation axis.
This property tells the exact date and time, when the action takes place.
Required grasping type, defined if important. Can have values: "internal grasping" or "external grasping".
Refers to the fixing parts that are used to assemble product .
Unit: Meters/second (m/s)
Unit: Newton meters (Nm)
A specific torque required.
This property defines the threading information of the feature.
This property defines the duration in seconds.
Unit: Millimeters (mm)
Resolution required from the process. E.g. minimum line width of marking operation.
Unit: Newton meters (Nm)
Maximum torque allowed to be applied
Unit: Millimeters (mm
ToleranceLowerValue indicates the lower value of the defined tolerance.
This property tells what type of surface treatment it is, like plastic coating or filming.
Unit: Millimeters (mm
ToleranceValue indicates the upper value of the defined tolerance.
Unit: Newton (N)
Minimum fixturing force that can hold the part.
Unit: Meters/second (m/s)
IMGModelUrl defines the URL for the picture (e.g. .png) of the given object.
This property defines the thickness of the surface treatment.
posZ tells the value of Z coordinate.
hasTolerance defines the tolerance assinged to the geometric feature.
Name of the entity.
Unit: Millimeters (mm
Diameter of the screw (nominal)
This property defines the position of the entity.
This property defines the URL to the referred 3D model.
This property defines the X vector component of the orientation axis.
This property defines the URL to the referred 2D drawing.
This property defines the orientation of the entity.
Unit: Millimeters (mm
Length of the screw
Property links the process with a certain geometric feature.
posY tells the value of Y coordinate.
Unit: parts/s
Required feed rate for feeding parts
Unit: Newton (N)
Maximum force that can be applied for grasping in order not to violate the part.
Unit: Newton (N)
Maximum fixturing force that should be applied.

This pro perty indicates how many times a certain activity is repeated during the same process cycle. E.g. if six similar screws are screwed in the same production phase, it is not needed to model that repetitive process multiple times.
Unit: Kilograms (kg)
Mass of an entity.
Unit: mm
Inner diameter of an object
Type of the screw head.
Unit: Newton meters (Nm)
Minimum torque allowed to be applied
This property defines the Y vector component of the orientation axis.
Unit: Meters/second (m/s)
Unit: Millimeters (mm)
Required accuracy of a process.

pt:Drilling.rdfs:comment: This is a test instance for product requirement description using the process taxonomy.

rdf:Description.owl:versionInfo: TODO: Screw details may be presented also as part of the product description --> Add classes and properties there (maybe for other fastener types as well).
TODO: This could also be expressed by modelling a geometric feature hole with associated dimensions.
